intro: Antirrhinum majus var. typicum, commonly known as the common snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that resemble a dragon's mouth, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and produces vibrant flowers in shades of red, yellow, pink, and white. Its foliage consists of oval, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. The common snapdragon is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
